memberdef.argsstring: (csl::Tensor const &impulsion, csl::Parent const &t_parent, const std::vector< csl::Index > &indices)
memberdef.name: PolarizationField

briefdescription.para: Allows to know if the object commutes with all the others.
Calculates and returns the complex conjugate of the expression.
Tells (for an Indicial type) if there is a special contraction property with B.

parameterdescription.para: Expression with which we test if there is a special contraction.

simplesect.para: True if there is a contraction.

briefdescription.para: Applies a special contraction of indices. Before calling this function we must check that there is indeed a contraction by calling the function hasContractionProperty().
Returns a mty::Particle, pointer to the parent of the field.

detaileddescription.para:
As QuantumField inherits from csl::TensorFieldElement, its parent is in the form of a csl::Parent. This function then makes a conversion to a mty::Particle before returning the pointer.
A shared pointer to the QuantumFieldParent (i.e. mty::Particle) of the field.

briefdescription.para: Sets the particle property of the particle.

parameterdescription.para: Must be true if the field is a particle, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Sets the incoming property of the particle.

parameterdescription.para: Must be true if the field is incoming, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Representing polarization vectors in equations. Allows to compute polarization sums in cross-sections. Is derived from TensorFieldElement: possess at least one csl::Index (polarization) and one "space-time point" that is the impulsion of the particle.
